title: What to know about the Sikh independence movement following US accusation that activist was targeted
content: The U.S. has charged an Indian national in what prosecutors allege was a failed plot to assassinate a Sikh separatist at the behest of an unnamed Indian government official
contentSnippet: The U.S. has charged an Indian national in what prosecutors allege was a failed plot to assassinate a Sikh separatist at the behest of an unnamed Indian government official

title: Some OPEC+ members will cut the oil that they send to the world to try to boost prices
content: The OPEC oil cartel and allied producers have made another big swipe at propping up lagging crude prices
contentSnippet: The OPEC oil cartel and allied producers have made another big swipe at propping up lagging crude prices

title: Japan suspends its Osprey flights after the fatal crash of a US Air Force aircraft
content: Japan has suspended flights of its Osprey aircraft after a U.S. Air Force Osprey based in Japan crashed into the sea during a training mission
contentSnippet: Japan has suspended flights of its Osprey aircraft after a U.S. Air Force Osprey based in Japan crashed into the sea during a training mission

title: 4 migrants who were pushed out of a boat die just yards from Spain's southern coast
content: Four migrants have died yards from shore in southern Spain after being forced out of the boat they were traveling in
contentSnippet: Four migrants have died yards from shore in southern Spain after being forced out of the boat they were traveling in

title: Russian missile strikes in eastern Ukraine tear through buildings and bury families
content: Ukrainian officials say Russian missiles tore through apartments in Donetsk.
contentSnippet: Ukrainian officials say Russian missiles tore through apartments in Donetsk.

title: Russia’s Supreme Court effectively outlaws LGBTQ+ activism in the country in a broad crackdown on beleaguered community

title: Somali maritime police intensify patrols as fears grow of resurgence of piracy in the Gulf of Aden
content: Somalia’s maritime police force has intensified patrols in the Gulf of Aden following a failed pirate hijacking of a ship earlier this week
contentSnippet: Somalia’s maritime police force has intensified patrols in the Gulf of Aden following a failed pirate hijacking of a ship earlier this week

title: Pope says he has acute bronchitis, doctors recommended against travel to avoid change in temperature
content: Pope Francis says he is suffering from acute and infectious bronchitis
contentSnippet: Pope Francis says he is suffering from acute and infectious bronchitis

title: South African company to start making vaginal rings that protect against HIV
content: A South African company will make vaginal rings that protect against HIV, which AIDS experts say should eventually make them cheaper and more readily available
contentSnippet: A South African company will make vaginal rings that protect against HIV, which AIDS experts say should eventually make them cheaper and more readily available

title: UK's Sunak ramps up criticism of Greek leader in Parthenon Marbles spat
content: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak has escalated his war of words with the leader of Greece
contentSnippet: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak has escalated his war of words with the leader of Greece

title: Nigeria's leader presents a $34 billion spending plan that prioritizes the economy and security
content: Nigeria’s leader has presented a $34.8 billion spending plan for 2024 to federal lawmakers with a focus on stabilizing Africa’s largest but ailing economy and tackling a deadly security crisis
contentSnippet: Nigeria’s leader has presented a $34.8 billion spending plan for 2024 to federal lawmakers with a focus on stabilizing Africa’s largest but ailing economy and tackling a deadly security crisis

title: Venezuela's planned vote over territory dispute leaves Guyana residents on edge
content: Congregants of an Anglican church in a sparsely populated rainforest village in Guyana are asking for peace for their community amid what they see as an existential threat
contentSnippet: Congregants of an Anglican church in a sparsely populated rainforest village in Guyana are asking for peace for their community amid what they see as an existential threat

title: German authorities arrest a 15-year-old on suspicion of planning an attack
content: German authorities arrested a boy, 15, on suspicion of planning a terror attack.
contentSnippet: German authorities arrested a boy, 15, on suspicion of planning a terror attack.

title: Three teenagers injured in knife attack at a high school in Poland
content: The 18-year-old attacker has been apprehended.
contentSnippet: The 18-year-old attacker has been apprehended.

title: Opposition protesters in Kosovo use flares and tear gas to protest against a war crimes court
content: Opposition protesters in Kosovo have used flares and tear gas to protest against a senior war crimes court official in the capital
contentSnippet: Opposition protesters in Kosovo have used flares and tear gas to protest against a senior war crimes court official in the capital

title: South Africa march demands a permanent Gaza cease-fire on day of solidarity with Palestinians
content: Members of South African political parties, civil society organisations and other supporters have marched through the streets of Johannesburg demanding a permanent cease-fire in Gaza as they marked the International Day of Solidarity with the Palestini...
contentSnippet: Members of South African political parties, civil society organisations and other supporters have marched through the streets of Johannesburg demanding a permanent cease-fire in Gaza as they marked the International Day of Solidarity with the Palestini...

title: Mali's government will probe Tuareg rebel leaders as crucial 2015 peace deal appears to crumble
content: Mali’s military government has announced an investigation into the Tuareg rebel leaders who signed a peace agreement in 2015 and now accuse the government of failing to comply with it
contentSnippet: Mali’s military government has announced an investigation into the Tuareg rebel leaders who signed a peace agreement in 2015 and now accuse the government of failing to comply with it

title: A special court has cleared France’s justice minister in an unprecedented conflict of interest case

title: At least 40 civilians killed by al-Qaida-linked rebels in a Burkina Faso town: UN
content: The United Nations' rights office says at least 40 civilians were killed last weekend by al-Qaida-linked rebels trying to take control of a besieged town in Burkina Faso’s hard-hit northern region
contentSnippet: The United Nations' rights office says at least 40 civilians were killed last weekend by al-Qaida-linked rebels trying to take control of a besieged town in Burkina Faso’s hard-hit northern region

title: Pakistan acquits ex-Premier Nawaz Sharif in a graft case
content: A Pakistani court has acquitted former Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif in a graft case, removing a major obstacle for him to run in parliamentary elections in February
contentSnippet: A Pakistani court has acquitted former Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif in a graft case, removing a major obstacle for him to run in parliamentary elections in February

title: Sweden's economy shrinks in the third quarter to signal that a recession may have hit the country
content: Sweden’s economy shrank in the third quarter of 2023 to mark the second time of contraction and signal that a recession may have hit the country
contentSnippet: Sweden’s economy shrank in the third quarter of 2023 to mark the second time of contraction and signal that a recession may have hit the country

title: Australia proposes new laws to detain potentially dangerous migrants
content: The Australian government has proposed new laws that would place behind bars some of the 141 migrants who have been set free in the three weeks since the High Court ruled their indefinite detention was unconstitutional
contentSnippet: The Australian government has proposed new laws that would place behind bars some of the 141 migrants who have been set free in the three weeks since the High Court ruled their indefinite detention was unconstitutional

title: Myanmar and China conduct naval drills together as fighting surges in border area
content: Myanmar and China are conducting naval drills together as the military government in the Southeast Asian nation loses ground in the northeast to a coalition of armed ethnic militias that also has strong ties to Beijing
contentSnippet: Myanmar and China are conducting naval drills together as the military government in the Southeast Asian nation loses ground in the northeast to a coalition of armed ethnic militias that also has strong ties to Beijing

title: Coal power, traffic, waste burning a toxic smog cocktail in Indonesia's Jakarta
content: Pollution is causing respiratory illnesses and deaths to rise in Indonesia's island of Java, including the capital, Jakarta
contentSnippet: Pollution is causing respiratory illnesses and deaths to rise in Indonesia's island of Java, including the capital, Jakarta

title: Australia apologizes for thalidomide tragedy as some survivors listen in the Parliament gallery
content: Survivors of the harmful morning sickness drug thalidomide were in the public gallery when Australia’s Parliament made a national apology for what was described as one of the darkest chapters in Australia’s medical history
contentSnippet: Survivors of the harmful morning sickness drug thalidomide were in the public gallery when Australia’s Parliament made a national apology for what was described as one of the darkest chapters in Australia’s medical history
